description: This course immerses students in the narrative, storytelling culture of Indigenous Australian and
New Zealand peoples, the Aboriginal and Maori cultures. Students gain an understanding of the
history of these peoples, their family culture, and storytelling as a healing and powerful force.
Students study Narrative Family Therapy and learn to articulate the parallels between it and
Aboriginal and Maori culture. Students also learn to apply this theory to their own lived
experience. Prerequisite: One of the following: FAMST 132, FAMST 242, SWRK 120, SWRK 122, SWRK
221, PSYCH 125, SOAN 121, SOAN 128, SOAN 260, SOAN 262, SOAN 264, RACE 121, RACE 252.
fullname: Storytelling, Healing and Family in Aboriginal and Maori Cultures
